statement.p: In the Desmos window below, there is a plot of the circle x^2 + y^2 = 16 along with a tangent line to the circle at a moveable point. You can drag the point around the circle and observe the corresponding slope of the tangent line.

li.p: Estimate the coordinates of a point at which the slope of the tangent line is m=0.
Estimate the coordinates of a point at which the slope of the tangent line is m=1.
Estimate the coordinates of a point at which the slope of the tangent line is m=-1.
Is there any numerical slope that is not achieved at some point on the circle? If yes, state that slope; if not, explain why not.
